meanings.definition: Relevant or applicable to a particular matter
meanings.sent1: It is pertinent to include all the necessary information in your report.
meanings.sent2: The witness provided pertinent details about the crime scene.
meanings.sent3: The detective found the cat's meow pertinent to solving the case.
meanings.sent4: Her timely arrival was as pertinent as a key unlocking a mystery.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's feedback was so pertinent that it stayed in my mind for days.

meanings.definition: Having a clear decisive relevance to the matter in hand
meanings.sent1: The judge made a pertinent decision based on the evidence presented.
meanings.sent2: His advice was always pertinent and helped me make the right choices.
meanings.sent3: The clown's red nose seemed oddly pertinent to the serious discussion.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as pertinent as sunshine breaking through the clouds.
meanings.sent5: The map was so pertinent that we never got lost during the hike.

meanings.definition: Directly related to the subject at hand
meanings.sent1: The student asked a pertinent question during the lecture.
meanings.sent2: The manager's feedback was always pertinent to improving our work.
meanings.sent3: The cat's sudden appearance was so pertinent to the conversation.
meanings.sent4: His words were as pertinent as arrows hitting the target.
meanings.sent5: The key to success is to focus on pertinent tasks and ignore distractions.
